ARABIC: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ ٱلصَّيْحَةُ بِٱلْحَقِّ فَجَعَلْنَٰهُمْ غُثَآءً فَبُعْدًا لِّلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The Great Blast seized hold of them inexorably and We turned them into dirty scum. Away with the people of the wrongdoers!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So they were rightly seized by a mighty blast; and We turned them into mouldy rubbish: A good riddance of the wicked people!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Then a mighty blast quite justly overtook them, and We reduced them to a rubble. So away with the wrong-doing folk!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: A blast struck them for a just cause, and We made them look like withered leaves. God keeps the unjust people away from His mercy.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So the true Scream seized them – We therefore made them like rotten hay; so away with the unjust people!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So, the Sayhah overtook them in truth, and We made them as rubbish of dead plants. So, away with the people who are wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So the punishment overtook them in justice, and We made them as rubbish; so away with the unjust people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And the Cry seized them justly, and We made them as scum; so away with the people of the evildoers!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: So the (Awful) Cry overtook them rightfully, and We made them like as wreckage (that a torrent hurleth). A far removal for wrongdoing folk!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: The blast justly struck them and We reduced them to rubble. Away with such wicked people!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then the shout laid hold of them in truth, and We made them a refuse; so away with the wrong-doing people!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So the Cry seized them justly and We turned them into a scum. So away with the wrongdoing lot!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Then the Blast overtook them with justice, and We made them as rubbish of dead leaves (floating on the stream of Time)! So away with the people who do wrong!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So As-Saihah (torment - awful cry, etc.) overtook them with justice, and We made them as rubbish of dead plants. So away with the people who are Zalimun (polytheists, wrong-doers, disbelievers in the Oneness of Allah, disobedient to His Messengers, etc.).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And the Cry seized them in justice and We made them withered. So begone with the harmdoing nation.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Then the Blast struck them, justifiably, and We turned them into scum. So away with the wicked people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So the shriek seized them in truth, and We made them as [plant] stubble. Then away with the wrongdoing people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [23:41] So the Cry, the Cry of chastisement and destruction, seized them rightfully, and they died, and We made them as husks (ghuthā’ is desiccated vegetation, in other words, We transformed them into similarly desiccated [worthless] things). So a far removal, from mercy, for the evildoing folk, the denying [folk].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (So the (Awful) Cry overtook them rightfully) i.e. the punishment, which is the cry of Gabriel, seized them, (and We made them) when the chastisement stopped (like a wreckage (that a torrent hurls). A far removal) an utter destruction and disappointment for failing to obtain Allah's mercy (for wrong-doing folk!) for the disbelievers.
